Description: A high-level attribute grouping variable.
A component for use as a mock template for defining file annotation metadata for an SDP.
DependsOn: Component, Filename, File Format, Resource Type, Sample Manifest SynID

Description: A component for collecting file-level metadata, i.e., annotations, for AMP AIM CyTOF standard data package (SDP).
DependsOn: Component, Filename, File Format, Resource Type, Sample Manifest SynID, Target Panel, Target Panel SynID

Description: Name of a file. Must be included in DependsOn for all file manifest/annotation templates.
Standard file format name or file extension
Valid Values: csv, tsv, txt, xlsx, xls, fcs, docx, erate, rec, info, vcf, dose, tbi, fam, bim, bed, bam, h5, mtx, bai, rds, pdf, tgz, zip, fastq, parquet, geojson, tar.gz, zip, omiq

Description: Clinical data about each study participant
Metadata about biospecimens collected from study subjects
DependsOn: Component, Subject ID, Visit ID, psid, Child PSID, Slide PSID

Description: Patient Component
A patient biological sample
Clinical Component
Unique identifier assigned to each study participant. Combination of disease team, site ID, and 3-digit ID
ID associated with specific type of patient visit
Project Sample ID, aka PSID, is a unique biospecimen identifier, the format can vary depending on the specimen or container type.
High level classification of a fileâ€™s content
Label indicating the tissue of biological source of the sample being profiled.
Valid Values: none, urine, stool, whole blood, serum, plasma, PBMCs, total leukocytes, kidney biopsy, synovial fluid, skin biopsy, salivary gland, saliva, skin swab, synovial tissue

Description: Biospecimen status before experimental data collection.
Valid Values: nuclei suspension, cell suspension, fresh tissue, frozen tissue, FFPE tissue, flow-sorted cells, PFA-fixed tissue

Description: A label further classifying the content of the metadata file.
Valid Values: sample manifest, assay metadata, protocol, data standard document, template, project description

Description: The technology used to generate the data in this file. For multimodal datasets with concomitant profiling of biospecimen select all assays that apply. e.g., the GEX files from a CITE-seq experiment should be labeled with both 'scRNASeq' and 'CITESeq'.
Valid Values: scRNASeq, CyTOF, Xenium, Olink, CITESeq, snRNASeq, snATACSeq, RNASeq, multiplexed ELISA, SNP array, imaging mass cytometry, H&E, ASAPSeq, CosMX, serial IHC, imaging mass spectrometry, LC-MS/MS, CE-MS, VDJSeq, scVDJSeq, feature barcode sequencing, SomaScan, WES, WGS, flow cytometry

Description: High-level classification of the type of data contained in the file, loosely related to the experimental method or biological entity that is being profiled. Select all that apply using a comma-delimited list, though in most cases only a single label is expected. For multimodal datasets with concomitant profiling of biospecimen include 'multimodal'.
Valid Values: transcriptomics, immune repertoire profiling, proteomics, multimodal, epigenomics, genomics, metabolomics, lipidomics, microbiome, histology, immunostaining, cytometry

Description: General classification to differentiate between omics profiling modalities. If N/A please select 'none'. Multiple selections can be provided in a comma-delimited list, however this is largely only expected in the context of Datasets and files that contain integrated experimental data spanning multiple types.
Valid Values: bulk, pseudobulk, single-cell, single-nucleus, spatial, none

Description: The processing level of the data as defined for the SDP

The specific version (manufacturer, model, etc.) of a technology that is used to carry out a laboratory or computational experiment. Specify where applicable for experimental data files, else enter 'none'. In most cases only a single label is expected, however multiple selections can be provided in comma-delimited list where applicable e.g., for 10x Genomics fastq files please specify both the 10x instrument and the sequencing platform.
Valid Values: CyTOF XT, Helios Mass Cytometer, Hyperion, Illumina NextSeq 500, Illumina HiSeq 2500, Illumina NovaSeq 6000, Helios Mass Cytometer, Hyperion, Illumina NovaSeq X, Chromium X, Chromium iX, Chromium Xo, Chromium Controller, Visium CytAssist, Xenium, none

Description: Relevant software and version used to generate the data file. If N/A please select 'none'.
Valid Values: OMIQ, Cell Ranger v9.0.0, Cell Ranger v8.0.1, Cell Ranger v8.0.0, Cell Ranger v7.2.0, Cell Ranger v7.1.0, Cell Ranger v7.0.1, Cell Ranger v7.0.0, Cell Ranger v6.1.2, Cell Ranger v6.1.1, Cell Ranger v6.1.0, Cell Ranger v6.0.2, Cell Ranger v6.0.1, Cell Ranger v6.0.0, Cell Ranger v5.0.1, Cell Ranger v5.0.0, Cell Ranger v4.0.0, Cell Ranger v3.1.0, Cell Ranger v3.0.2, Cell Ranger v3.0.1, Cell Ranger v3.0.0, Space Ranger 3.1.2, Space Ranger 3.1.1, Space Ranger 3.1.0, Space Ranger 3.0.1, Space Ranger 3.0.0, OMIQ 2024-12, none

DependsOn: Specimen Modality, Assay, Data Level, Data Type, Data Subtype, Platform, Software and Version

Description: Label assigned to experimental data files indicating whether the data contained corresponds to a single or multiple biospecimens
An experimental data file that contains data points generated from a single biospecimen. Is a valid value of Specimen Modality that triggers conditional dependencies for other attributes.
DependsOn: Subject ID, Visit ID, Project Sample ID, Biospecimen Type, Biospecimen Subtype

Description: Synapse ID of SDP sample manifest that maps samples to each multi-specimen file.
Unique or established human-readable name assigned to the panel of targets profiled in the experimental data files
Synapse ID of Target Panel metadata file.
